The New York State Department of Taxation and Finance will help prepare and E-file income tax returns FREE!* You may make an appointment or walk-in. What You'll Need to Bring: - Drivers license or state-issued non-drived ID (for you and your spouse) - Photo ID (if you do not have a driver's license or state-issued non-driver ID) - Birth dates and social security numbers for you, your spouse, and your dependents - Income documents - such as Form W-2, Form 1098, and Form 1099 - Healthcare statements (1095-A, 1095-B, 1095-C) - Supporting information for claiming tax credits - Routing number and account number to direct deposit any refund

As the first ever female rap crew, Salt-N-Pepa, broke barriers and opened doors wide open that were once closed to women in hip-hop. They gave women a voice in a male dominated industry and transformed the way the music world saw women forever. With the hit songs "Push It," "Tramp,""Shake Your Thang," "Shoop" and "Whatta Man," Salt-N-Pepa would defy everyone's expectations and catapult hip-hop to new levels.

From Vietnam to Woodstock, from Sesame Street to the moonÑ1969 was a year where events across the country shaped our culture. Journey back to 1969 to explore the events and stories of this watershed year.  The Opening Reception will feature special remarks by the Director of NYS Division of Veterans' Services, Jim McDonough, and NYS Assembly Sergeant at Arms Wayne Jackson, a veteran of the Vietnam War. This event is FREE and open to the public. Gallery Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. The exhibit runs May 8, 2019 through January 3, 2020.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby, Robert Abrams Justice Building, Empire State Plaza,Albany, NY 12242

Free event on the South Concourse featuring health, wellness, and financial services

This free tour will focus on the history of the suffrage movement in New York State. New York State is where the first Women's Rights Convention was held in Seneca Falls in 1848 and where women won the right to vote in 1917, three years before the 19th amendment was ratified. This special one-hour tour will explore the connections between the New York State Capitol and the historic fight for suffrage. Tour highlights include the stories of several equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls as well as the stateÕs first female legislators.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Information Desk

Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Which two US presidents visited the Capitol after their death? Where are the Assembly Chamber's "Lost Murals" and what happened to their tormented creator? These dark secrets and more will be revealed during this year's New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. Registration is required.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Which two US presidents visited the Capitol after their death? Where are the Assembly Chamber's "Lost Murals" and what happened to their tormented creator? These dark secrets and more will be revealed during this year's New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. These special tours explore the legends  folklore  and “ghost stories” connected to the historic state Capitol.Registration is required for this event.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Description: This FREE 30-minute lunchtime tour invites all to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at the Empire State Plaza Art Collection. Each tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including  Art in Public Spaces  Art and War  Art Inspired by Native America  the history of the Plaza Art Commission and more! Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza. If it rains  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Corning Tower Security Desk  Concourse Level

Event Description: Volunteerism is at the heart of Dr. King's philosophy. The purpose of the "Be A King" Volunteer Fair is to introduce people to the ways they can become actively involved in civic and community programs. The greatest tribute we can bestow upon the memory of Dr. King is to invite people of all backgrounds to celebrate this special holiday held in his honor by performing individual acts of kindness through service to others.

Classes involve high-intensity bursts of body weight movements followed by short intervals of rest that are designed to keep burning calories long after the class ends. Although the classes are challenging, they are designed to accommodate people of all fitness levels.
Event Location: Empire State Plaza Hart Lounge in the Egg

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Which two US presidents visited the Capitol after their death? Where are the Assembly Chamber's "Lost Murals" and what happened to their tormented creator? These dark secrets and more will be revealed during this year's New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. These special tours explore the legends  folklore  and “ghost stories” connected to the historic state Capitol.Registration is required for this event.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Name: The Bandleader Who Changed America Presentation
Event Description: Presented by JDog Junk Removal & Hauling in conjunction with the exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters  on view in the Vietnam Memorial Gallery of the Robert Abrams Building for Law and Justice at the Empire State Plaza - this multimedia presentation will focus on the life and music of James Reese Europe  an extraordinary individual who was not only instrumental in the success of an African-American regiment from New York that was dispatched to fight for France in World War I  but had a major influence in the development of jazz  swing  and contemporary dance.Featuring special guests Michael Dinwiddie  Associate Professor at New York University's Gallatin School  and William Meckley  founder and music director of the Empire Jazz Orchestra  as well as musical demonstrations and performances by Schenectady High School educator  jazz pianist and composer David Gleason. The event starts at 6:30p  doors open at 6:00p. Visit empirestateplaza.org or contact the Plaza Visitor Center at 518-474-2418 for more info.

Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Empire State Plaza

Event Description: Wednesdays from 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Which two US presidents visited the Capitol after their death? Where are the Assembly Chamber's "Lost Murals" and what happened to their tormented creator? These dark secrets and more will be revealed during this year's New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. Registration is required.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Which two US presidents visited the Capitol after their death? Where are the Assembly Chamber's "Lost Murals" and what happened to their tormented creator? These dark secrets and more will be revealed during this year's New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. These special tours explore the legends  folklore  and “ghost stories” connected to the historic state Capitol.Registration is required for this event.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Empire State Plaza

Event Name: New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour
Event Description: Which two United States Presidents visited the Capitol after they died? What happened to the "lost" Capitol murals and their eccentric artist? Does the secret demon carved in stone hold a Capitol curse? Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Explore these questions and other tales of sightings and strange things on our Special New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. The tour lasts about an hour, but the chilling tales might haunt you foreve

Explore these questions and other tales of sightings and strange things on our Special New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. The tour lasts about an hour, but the chilling tales might haunt you foreve
Event Location: Information Desk in Capitol's State Street Lobby

Event Description: Wednesdays from 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Free event on the South Concourse featuring health, wellness, and financial services.

Date: Wednesday, November 1, 2023 Time: 10:00 a.m.- 2:00 p.m. Location: South Concourse Additional information: No appointments will be necessary. Please be sure to bring proof of insurance. A cash-only, out-of-pocket option is available. A cost of $37 is associated with regular and preservative-free flu shots. The over-65 flu shot cost will be $72. Please note that alternative flu shot options are subject to availability. For more information, contact OGS Special Events (518) 474-4759

Event Description: The Empire State Plaza Farmers Market is your place to find the season's freshest produce  flowers  plants  meats  cheeses  baked goods  wine  cider and much more! We'll see you outside on the West Roadway every Wednesday and Friday from May to October.

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Does the night watchman who died in the Capitol Fire of 1911 still make his rounds? Which two US presidents visited the Capitol after their death? Where are the Assembly Chamber's "Lost Murals" and what happened to their tormented creator? These dark secrets and more will be revealed during this year's New York State Capitol Hauntings Tour. These special tours explore the legends  folklore  and “ghost stories” connected to the historic state Capitol.Registration is required for this event.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: Lunchtime Music presented by M&T Bank
Event Description: Lunchtime Musical Performances at the Empire State Plaza Farmers Market Presented By Green M&T Bank LogoWednesdays, June 5 - August 21* 12:00 - 1:30 p.m. 11 weeks of fun featuring the popular Empire State Plaza Farmer’s Market, the adjacent Plaza food truck program and lunchtime performances that cross all genres.

Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Empire State Plaza

Event Description: A fall festival with a featured performance by The Infamous Stringdusters! The Infamous Stringdusters have consistently covered new ground  inspired fans  and redefined what a bluegrass band can be. They won a 2018 Grammy for "Best Bluegrass Album" for their 2017 release Laws of Gravity. Also featuring the best of Fall in upstate New York including local craft beverages fall recipes  and bluegrass music.

This FREE 30-minute lunchtime tour invites all to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at the Empire State Plaza Art Collection. Each tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including  Art in Public Spaces  Art and War  Art Inspired by Native America  the history of the Plaza Art Commission and more! Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza. If it rains  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Corning Tower Security Desk  Concourse Level

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Empire State Plaza

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: Jazz on the Plaza - Sweet Megg & the Wayfarers
Event Description: Jazz on the Plaza features Sweet Megg & the Wayfarers. Led by the charmingly enigmatic Sweet Megg  the band seamlessly incorporates elements of New Orleans Swing  Harlem swing  Parisian cabaret  and gut bucket blues into one charming musical performance.

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

This FREE 30-minute lunchtime tour invites all to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at the Empire State Plaza Art Collection. Each tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including  Art in Public Spaces  Art and War  Art Inspired by Native America  the history of the Plaza Art Commission and more! Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza. If it rains  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Corning Tower Security Desk  Concourse Level

Event Name: New  York State Women’s Suffrage Exhibition
Event Description: The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just east of the War Room.

The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza is at the center of one of the most spectacular capitals in the world. This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Name: New  York State Women’s Suffrage Exhibition
Event Description: The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just east of the War Room.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: Capital Concert Series - Blue Oyster Cult
Event Description: The Capital Concert Series  presented by Miller Lite  is a series of events presented free to the public! This week features Blue Oyster Cult. Blue Oyster Cult has been thrilling fans worldwide for four decades with classic songs such as the truly haunting "(Don't Fear) The Reaper" from 1976's Agents of Fortune and the pummeling "Godzilla" from 1977's Spectres. Cited as a major influence by legends like Metallica  the Long Island based band is revered within the hard rock and heavy metal community for its pioneering work.

Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Everyone is welcome to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at art. Tours will invite participants to engage with the collection and learn the history of featured artists. Every tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including: sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza; if there is rain  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Concourse at the base of the Corning Tower

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: Presented by Miller Lite on Wednesday, July 10 from 5:30 - 8:30 p.m.

Event Description: The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just east of the War Room.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The popular Santa Sale is a multi-day sale offering shoppers a chance to purchase gifts for everyone on their list! With options from sports memorabilia to jewelry and clothing, there is something for everyone!

The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza is at the center of one of the most spectacular capitals in the world. This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

The Empire State Plaza Farmers Market is your place to find the season's freshest produce  flowers  plants  meats  cheeses  baked goods  wine  cider and much more! We'll see you outside on the West Roadway every Wednesday and Friday from May to October.

Explore one of the greatest collections of public art in the country on a 30-minute lunchtime tour of the Empire State Plaza Art Collection. Learn about Abstract Expressionism  the New York School of artists and discover new ways of looking at art. Each tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including  sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will take place inside and out.
Event Location: Corning Tower Security Desk  Concourse Level

Event Description: Everyone is welcome to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at art. Tours will invite participants to engage with the collection and learn the history of featured artists. Every tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including: sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza; if there is rain  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Concourse at the base of the Corning Tower

Come down to the Empire State Plaza for the annual New York State Food Festival featuring Everclear! Everclear has written and recorded some truly iconic '90s alt-rock hits like "Santa Monica" and "Father of Mine."  With plans to mix it up and dig into the catalog  Everclear's performance promises to offer fans a rare treat into past material - especially the "deep cuts." In addition to live music  the New York State Food Festival sheds a spotlight on New York State producers and specialty products  New York State beers  and the popular Farmers Market.

You may register for individual classes to sign the waiver in advance and to allow us to contact you regarding updates to the schedule. Walk-ins are always welcome! For more information  please visit https://ogs.ny.gov/esp/FitnessAtPlaza.asp.
Event Location: Plaza Level  between Agency Buildings 2 and 3

Event Description: The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza is at the center of one of the most spectacular capitals in the world. This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.
Tuesdays & Thursdays from 5:00 - 6:00 p.m.

The popular Santa Sale is a multi-day sale offering shoppers a chance to purchase gifts for everyone on their list! With options from sports memorabilia to jewelry and clothing, there is something for everyone!

Event Name: New  York State Women’s Suffrage Exhibition
Event Description: The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just east of the War Room.

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: Capital Concert Series - Grand Funk Railroad
Event Description: The Capital Concert Series  presented by Miller Lite  is a series of events presented free to the public! This week features Grand Funk Railroad. Grand Funk's legacy still reigns over the classic rock landscape with mega-hits such as "We're An American Band " "I'm Your Captain/Closer to Home " "Locomotion " and "Some King of Wonderful." Internationally acclaimed  Grand Funk has toured the world selling out dates in the U.S.  Canada  Europe  and beyond. Over their career  Grand Funk has seen chart top success including eight Top 40 hits and two number one singles!Please note  this concert will be held at the Corning Preserve Boat Launch  located under the 787 underpass at Colonie & Water Streets.

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just off the War Room.

Event Description: Everyone is welcome to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at art. Tours will invite participants to engage with the collection and learn the history of featured artists. Every tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including: sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza; if there is rain  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Concourse at the base of the Corning Tower

This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

The Empire State Plaza Farmers Market is your place to find the season's freshest produce  flowers  plants  meats  cheeses  baked goods  wine  cider and much more! We'll see you outside on the West Roadway every Wednesday and Friday from May to October.

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: A variety of local food vendors will be serving lunch every day outdoors at the Plaza!

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Description: The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza is at the center of one of the most spectacular capitals in the world. This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just off the War Room.

Event Name: Capital Concert Series - Toots & the Maytals
Event Description: The Capital Concert Series  presented by Miller Lite  is a series of events presented free to the public! This week features Toots & the Maytals. Toots is one of the true architects of Reggae  so much so that "Do the Reggay " a 1968 single by Toots and his group  the Maytals  is credited with giving the genre its name. Drenched in soul and rooted in gospel  at the heart of it all is Toots' voice  still breathtakingly powerful after almost four decades in the spotlight.

The Empire State Plaza Farmers Market is your place to find the season's freshest produce  flowers  plants  meats  cheeses  baked goods  wine  cider and much more! We'll see you outside on the West Roadway every Wednesday and Friday from May to October.

Come out on Wednesdays for Lunchtime at the Plaza  featuring live musical performances out by the farmers market. From Latin Jazz and Reggae  to Big Band Swing and Acoustic Soul – there’s a world of music this summer at the Plaza!

The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just off the War Room.

Event Location: Plaza Level  between Agency Buildings 2 and 3

Event Location: Plaza Level  between Agency Buildings 2 and 3

Event Description: The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza is at the center of one of the most spectacular capitals in the world. This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just off the War Room.

The Capital Concert Series  presented by Miller Lite  is a series of events presented free to the public! This week features En Vogue. As one of the top five highest selling American female music groups in history  En Vogue has sold over 20 million albums to date. Boasting recognizable hits like "Free Your Mind" and "Whatta Man" (featuring Salt N Peppa)  En Vogue is grounded in R&B  but shows their appreciation for diverse musical genres in their new album  Electric Cafe. With timeless appeal and resonant voices  don't miss what promises to be a stellar performance!

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Explore one of the greatest collections of public art in the country on a 30-minute lunchtime tour of the Empire State Plaza Art Collection. Learn about Abstract Expressionism  the New York School of artists and discover new ways of looking at art. Each tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including  sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will take place inside and out.
Event Location: Corning Tower Security Desk  Concourse Level

Event Description: Come out on Wednesdays for Lunchtime at the Plaza  featuring live musical performances out by the farmers market. From Latin Jazz and Reggae  to Big Band Swing and Acoustic Soul – there’s a world of music this summer at the Plaza!
A variety of local food vendors will be serving lunch every day outdoors at the Plaza!

Smash Mouth will be headlining New York State's 4th of July Celebration presented by Price Chopper and Market 32. Smash Mouth has not slowed down in the two decades since their single  “Walking On the Sun” became an international sensation. 2018 promises to be a watershed year for the legendary  several times-platinum  veteran pop stars with all five members back in the “Classic” Smash Mouth lineup.  If Smash Mouth isn't enough to get you down to the Plaza  we'll have more music from local favorite Moriah Formica of The Voice  craft and food vendors  and a stunning fireworks display!

Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: A variety of local food vendors will be serving lunch every day outdoors at the Plaza!

The Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Empire State Plaza is at the center of one of the most spectacular capitals in the world. This 98½-acre city-within-a-city includes one of the greatest public collections of modern art in the country  a cultural education center  and a unique performing arts center  The Egg. Learn how government and culture are housed within the modern architecture of the Plaza on a FREE 30-minute walking tour. Highlights include the Plaza's memorials  a visit inside The Egg  and an overview of the Plaza Art Collection.

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

The exhibition  1918: The New Day For New York Women  is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this exhibit tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The exhibition is located in 2nd Floor Lobby of the New York State Capitol  just off the War Room.

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: This special 30-minute tour explores the creation  struggle  triumph and legacy of WWI’s most storied regiment  the 369th Infantry. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicknamed the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to their actions on the battlefield. The tour visits the WWI exhibition at the New York State Capitol which features Sgt. Henry Johnson’s Medal of Honor and will end at the exhibition  Their Glory Will Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters  located in the Empire State Plaza  Abrams Justice Building  Vietnam Memorial Gallery.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: This special 30-minute New York State Capitol tour is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this tour tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The tour also invites visitors to explore 1918: The New Day For New York Women exhibition in the East Lobby of the Capitol.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The popular Santa Sale is a multi-day sale offering shoppers a chance to purchase gifts for everyone on their list! With options from sports memorabilia to jewelry and clothing, there is something for everyone!

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a video presentation of images  narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Description: Everyone is welcome to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at art. Tours will invite participants to engage with the collection and learn the history of featured artists. Every tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including: sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza; if there is rain  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Concourse at the base of the Corning Tower

Event Description: This special 30-minute tour explores the creation  struggle  triumph and legacy of WWI’s most storied regiment  the 369th Infantry. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicknamed the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to their actions on the battlefield. The tour visits the WWI exhibition at the New York State Capitol which features Sgt. Henry Johnson’s Medal of Honor and will end at the exhibition  Their Glory Will Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters  located in the Empire State Plaza  Abrams Justice Building  Vietnam Memorial Gallery.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a video presentation of images  narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Description: This special 30-minute New York State Capitol tour is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this tour tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The tour also invites visitors to explore 1918: The New Day For New York Women exhibition in the East Lobby of the Capitol.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Everyone is welcome to learn more about Abstract Expressionism and discover new ways of looking at art. Tours will invite participants to engage with the collection and learn the history of featured artists. Every tour will focus on a different selection of artworks and on various themes including: sculptures in nature  women artists in the collection  art you can touch  creating the collection  artists who are World War II veterans  and art as propaganda in the Cold War. Weather permitting  tours will look at pieces located outdoors on the Plaza; if there is rain  tours will take place inside on the concourse.
Event Location: Concourse at the base of the Corning Tower

Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: This special 30-minute tour explores the creation  struggle  triumph and legacy of WWI’s most storied regiment  the 369th Infantry. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicknamed the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to their actions on the battlefield. The tour visits the WWI exhibition at the New York State Capitol which features Sgt. Henry Johnson’s Medal of Honor and will end at the exhibition  Their Glory Will Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters  located in the Empire State Plaza  Abrams Justice Building  Vietnam Memorial Gallery.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts.The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a video presentation of images  narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: Free outdoor HIIT and yoga classes that are open to individuals of all ages and fitness levels! All participants are required to sign a waiver in order to participate. You may register for individual classes to sign the waiver in advance and to allow us to contact you regarding updates to the schedule. Walk-ins are always welcome! For more information  please visit https://ogs.ny.gov/esp/FitnessAtPlaza.asp.
Event Location: Plaza Level  between Agency Buildings 2 and 3

Event Description: This special 30-minute New York State Capitol tour is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this tour tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The tour also invites visitors to explore 1918: The New Day For New York Women exhibition in the East Lobby of the Capitol.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images that will be narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: This special 30-minute tour explores the creation  struggle  triumph and legacy of WWI’s most storied regiment  the 369th Infantry. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicknamed the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to their actions on the battlefield. The tour visits the WWI exhibition at the New York State Capitol which features Sgt. Henry Johnson’s Medal of Honor and will end at the exhibition  Their Glory Will Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters  located in the Empire State Plaza  Abrams Justice Building  Vietnam Memorial Gallery.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Name: Capital Concert Series - Toots & the Maytals
Event Description: Toots is one of the true architects of Reggae  so much so that "Do the Reggay " a 1968 single by Toots and his group  the Maytals  is credited with giving the genre its name. Drenched in soul and rooted in gospel  at the heart of it all is Toots' voice  still breathtakingly powerful after almost four decades in the spotlight.

Event Description: This special 30-minute New York State Capitol tour is a continuation of the state’s Women’s Suffrage Centennial Celebration. Highlighting the many equal-rights crusaders who marched the Capitol halls and the state’s first female legislators  this tour tells the story of the hard-fought journey from Seneca Falls to suffrage. The tour also invites visitors to explore 1918: The New Day For New York Women exhibition in the East Lobby of the Capitol.

Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: A variety of local food vendors will be serving lunch every day outdoors at the Plaza!

Event Name: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters Exhibition
Event Description: Visit the NYS Office of General Services' new exhibition  Their Glory Can Never Fade: The Legacy of the Harlem Hellfighters. The 369th served longer than any American regiment of World War I  and was nicked named the "Hellfighters" by the German army due to its actions on the battlefield. The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images that will be narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Name: Tour the New York State Capitol
Event Description: Monday through Friday at 10:00 a.m. and noon.

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images that will be narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

The exhibition features historical objects and images  including a presentation of images that will be narrated by Noble Sissle Jr.  son of 369th veteran and musician Noble Sissle; Bronx Music Heritage Center Folklorist  City Lore and Co-Artistic Director Elena Martinez; 369 Experience Program Executive Producer Stephany Neal; and 369th Veterans Association Inc. Albany NY. President Deryl McCray. Exhibition runs from February 1  2018 to February 28  2019.
Event Location: Vietnam Memorial Gallery Lobby  Robert Abrams Justice Building

Event Description: Looking for a FREE and unique experience for all ages? Take a guided tour of the New York State Capitol in Albany  New York. Designated a National Historic Landmark in 1979  the Capitol sits majestically atop Albany's State Street hill. Marvel the hand carved sandstone staircases  learn about New York's diverse history and walk in the footsteps of past governors and presidents. Tour Times: Monday - Friday at 10AM  12Noon  2PM & 3PM. Tour reservations are only required for groups of 10 or more.
Event Location: Capitol State Street Lobby Info Desk

Event Description: Looking for something new to read? The Grassroots Givers book sale includes thousands of books in various genres. There will also be CDs  DVDs  and children's books available for purchase. Stop by and find your next favorite book!
Summer craft shows on the South Concourse at the Empire State Plaza featuring handmade goods, jewelry, apparel, and more!

The Corning Tower Observation Deck offers breathtaking views of Albany  the Plaza  Capitol and surrounding area. Also visible are the Hudson River Valley  the Port of Albany  large portions of the city and its government  the foothills of the Adirondacks  the Catskills  and the Berkshires of western Massachusetts. The 42-story building was dedicated in 1983 to the memory of Erastus Corning 2nd  a long-time mayor of Albany who played a special role in the creation of the Plaza as the center of state government. The Tower is the tallest building in New York State outside of New York City. The building dominates the Albany skyline with its glass  marble and angular forms.

Event Description: The Empire State Plaza Farmers Market is your place to find the season's freshest produce  flowers  plants  meats  cheeses  baked goods  wine  cider and much more! We'll see you inside on the Concourse every Wednesday from October through April.The Plaza Farmers Market is part of the New York State FreshConnect program  which is designed to meet the needs of communities by bringing fresh food to underserved areas  improving nutrition education  and helping create local jobs.

The New York State Missing Persons Remembrance is dedicated to the men  women and children of NYS who have been reported missing. The Remembrance stands on a hill on the southeast corner of Madison Avenue and Swan Street in Albany  NY. The Remembrance serves as a place for families and loved ones to reflect and remember those who have gone missing. It is a square  granite base surmounted by a 20-foot stainless steel frame that is supporting an eternal flame  symbolizing the idea of "providing the light home."The New York State Missing Persons Remembrance is dedicated to the men  women and children of NYS who have been reported missing. The Remembrance stands on a hill on the southeast corner of Madison Avenue and Swan Street in Albany  NY. The Remembrance serves as a place for families and loved ones to reflect and remember those who have gone missing. It is a square  granite base surmounted by a 20-foot stainless steel frame that is supporting an eternal flame  symbolizing the idea of "providing the light home."
Event Location: Southeast corner of Madison Avenue and Swan Street
